nodes.bodyText: Make this static.
since we reference this string elsewhere, should we make it a constant?
It's a test class, so not terribly worried about this.
just an fyi, with regex, I like to give an example of typical cases in javadocs nearby. Any chance we could add one here?
Test class, plus this code is slated for removal down the track.

This turned out really nice.
Should this be a static method?
Yes: #1296 (comment)
it's unfortunate the order changes between these two events
Can you elaborate? I'm not sure what you mean.
Talked about this offline and the reasoning for it, and we're happy with the implementation as-is.
is there any risk, switch to seconds is not granular enough to avoid conflicts / reorderings?
It's not a switch, it was always seconds, but the / 1000 calculation was just done deeper down. (I see you noticed that https://github.com/firebase/firebase-android-sdk/pull/1296/files#r385929479)
The fact that this needed a comment makes me wonder: Is this worth pulling into a static method? A clever name could reduce the need for a javadoc
Yeah, that's fair.
Is it worth flipping the boolean to be includeCurrent to avoid the double negative?
Yeah, was trying to minimize the amount of change in this one PR, but I'll look at it.
I see, we always converted it to seconds, so that's why you're doing that here.
Should the other constructor become private?
No, but package-private for testing, yes.
The constructor is currently package-private, so not taking any action here.
How do we draw the line of which things get passed in vs made inside this create call? some things (e.g., this strategy) are created before the create call and injected in.)

The things passed in this create call are all the underlying collaborators necessary to make the coordinator work in its default configuration (where 'configuration' is defined as the group of collaborators passed to the constructor). Most of these abstractions aren't perfect, so this create call is a bit messy. Would love to discuss this further if you have ideas about how to clean it up.
Discussed this offline and decided this is fine for now.
